DataElement.preferredName: Patient Required Surgery Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients based on having appropriate surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients based on having appropriate surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Required; necessary, not optional.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had appropria
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had appropriate surgery including appendectomy (unless patient has history of prior appendectomy) for ovarian or fallopian tube carcinoma with appropriate tissue available for histologic evaluation to confirm diagnosis and stage?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had an appropriate procedure for determining diagnosis of epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal, fallopian tube, or carcinosarcoma with appropriate tissue available for histologic evaluation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: MA39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has been treated by breast conserving surgery (BCS) or mastectomy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1805CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Received only surgery as treatment for head and neck cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT_MA39_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has been treated by breast conserving surgery (BCS) or mastectomy with clear margins of excision*.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the lesions chosen for surgical therapy deemed appropriate targets for safe, gross total resection by the treating surgeon?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the lesion chosen for surgical therapy deemed an appropriate target for safe, gross total resection by the treating surgeon?
